accountIdHeaderOptional.description: The identifier of an account. The account must be a global advertising account..

clientHeader.description: The identifier of a client associated with a **Login with Amazon** account.
clientHeader.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

profileHeader.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.

404NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found.

Bid.description: The associated bid. Note that this value must be less than the budget associated with the Advertiser account. For more information, see [supported features](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/v2/guides/supported_features).

BrandType.description:
| brandType | description |
|-----------|-------------|
| brandRegistry | The brand is in the brand registry. |
| bookAuthor    | The brand is a book author. |

CreativeType.description: collection is deprecated in favor of productCollection.

Goal.description:
The goal type of the campaign.
If no goal is selected then it will default to `PAGE_VISIT`.
| goal | description |
|-----------|-------------|
| BRAND_IMPRESSION_SHARE | Brand Impression Share (BIS) i...

MatchType.description: The match type. For more information, see [match types](https://advertising.amazon.com/help#GHTRFDZRJPW6764R) in the Amazon Ads support center.

MaxResults.description: Sets a limit on the number of results returned by an operation.

MaxResultsRecommendations.description: Sets a limit on the number of results returned by an operation.

MediaStatus.description:
Media status:
 * `Processing` - The media is being processed
 * `PendingDeepValidation` - The media is pending additional validation carried out during media conversion.

NegativeMatchType.description: The negative match type. For more information, see [negative keyword match types](https://advertising.amazon.com/help#GHTRFDZRJPW6764R) in the Amazon Ads support center.

NextToken.description: Operations that return paginated results include a pagination token in this field. To retrieve the next page of results, call the same operation and specify this token in the request. If the `NextToken` field is empty, there are no further results.

keywordText.description: The text of the keyword. Maximum of 10 words.

matchType.description: MatchType should be non-null and non-empty

SBBidRecommendationKeywordIndex.description: Correlates the keyword to the keyword array index specified in the request. Zero-based.

SBBidRecommendationThemeIndex.description: Correlates the theme targets to the theme targets array index specified in the request. Zero-based.

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

details.description: A human-readable description of the response.

endDate.description: The end date in YYYYMMDD format.

startDate.description: The start date in YYYYMMDD format.

suggestedBudgetIncreasePercent.description: The suggested budget increase expressed as a percent.

campaignId.description: The campaign identifier.

SBBudgetRulesRecommendationEventResponse.description: Special events with date range and suggested budget increase.

recommendedBudgetRuleEvents.description: A list of recommended special events with date range and suggested budget increase.

estimatedReach.description: (As of 05/28/2024, `STREAMING_VIDEO` is deprecated). The estimated daily reach range of the category. Only set when supply source is `STREAMING_VIDEO`

isTargetable.description: Set to `true` if the category can be targeted in a targeting expression, and `false` if not.

path.description: The path of the category within the category catalogue.

translatedName.description: The category name translated to the specified locale in the request.

translatedPath.description: The path of the category within the category catalogue translated to the specified locale in the request.

adGroupId.description: The identifier of an existing ad group. The newly created target is associated to this ad group.

campaignId.description: The identifier of an existing campaign. The newly created target is associated to this campaign.

adGroupId.description: The identifier of an existing ad group. The newly created target is associated to this ad group.

campaignId.description: The identifier of an existing campaign. The newly created target is associated to this campaign.

createTargetErrorResults.description: Lists errors that occured during target creation. Note that errors are correlated to target create requests by the `targetRequestIndex` field.

createTargetSuccessResults.description: Lists the successfully created targets. Note that targets in the response are correlated to targets in the request using the `targetRequestIndex` field. For example, if `targetRequestIndex` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third target object in the request.

adGroupId.description: The identifier of the ad group to which the target is associated.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign to which the target is associated.

error.description: Lists errors that occurred during theme target creation. Note that errors are correlated to theme target create requests by the `index` field.

success.description: Lists the successfully created theme targets. Note that theme targets in the response are correlated to theme targets in the request using the `index` field. For example, if `index` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third theme target object in the request.

SBExpression.description: A name value pair that defines a targeting expression. The `type` field defines the predicate. The `value` field defines the value to match for the predicate.

value.description: The text of the targeting expression. The `-` token defines a range. For example, `2-4` defines a range of 2, 3, and 4.

SBKeyword.description: Applies to: | Operation | Path | |-----------| -----| |[listKeywords](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/v3/reference/SponsoredBrands/Keywords)| GET /sb/keywords| |[getKeyword](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/v3/reference/SponsoredBrands/Keywords)| GET /sb/keywords/{keywordId}|

adGroupId.description: The identifier of the ad group associated with the keyword.

bid.description: The bid associated with the keyword. Note that this value must be less than the budget associated with the Advertiser account.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign associated with the keyword.

keywordText.description: The keyword text. The maximum number of words for this string is 10.

nativeLanguageKeyword.description: The unlocalized keyword text in the preferred locale of the advertiser.

value.description: The text of the keyword. Maximum of 10 words.

SBKeywordRecommendationCreativeType.description: Optional SB creative type used for generating static or video generated keyword recommendations.  Inferred by asins if not included.

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

details.description: A human-readable description of the response.

SBKeywordRecommendationGoal.description: Optionally indicate the desired goal of your campaign. Different keyword recommendations will be provided depending on your specified goal.

SBKeywordRecommendationImpressionRank.description: The account-level ad-attributed impression rank for the search-term / keyword. Provides the [1:N] place the advertiser ranks among all advertisers for the keyword by ad impressions in a marketplace in the last 7 days. It tells an advertiser how many advertisers had higher share of ad impressions.

SBKeywordRecommendationImpressionShare.description: The account-level ad-attributed impression share for the search-term / keyword. Provides percentage share of all ad impressions the advertiser has for the keyword in the last 7 days. This metric helps advertisers identify potential opportunities based on their share of relevant keywords.

SBKeywordRecommendationMatchType.description: The match type. For more information, see [match types](https://advertising.amazon.com/help#GHTRFDZRJPW6764R) in the Amazon Advertising support center.

items.description: An array of landing page ASINs.
Optional. An array of creative ASINs that are displayed in the SB creative.

locale.description: Optional locale to request keyword suggestion translations. For example, to request Simplified Chinese translations in US, provide locale “zh_CN”.

maxNumSuggestions.description: Maximum number of suggestions to return. Max value is 1000. If not provided, default to 100.

items.description: Optional. An array of creative ASINs that are displayed in the SB creative.

locale.description: Optional locale to request keyword suggestion translations. For example, to request Simplified Chinese translations in US, provide locale “zh_CN”.

maxNumSuggestions.description: Maximum number of suggestions to return. Max value is 1000. If not provided, default to 100.

url.description: The URL of the Stores page, or, Vendors may also specify the URL of a custom landing page.

SBKeywordRecommendationType.description: A recommendation identifier that describes the suggested action for the recommendation. |Identifier|Description| |----------|-----------| |addKeyword|The suggested action is to add the keyword.|

description.description: A human-readable description of the enumerated response code in the `code` field.

translation.description: Localized keyword value if locale was specified.

value.description: The text of the negative expression.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign associated with the keyword.

keywordText.description: The keyword text. The maximum number of words for this string is 10.

SBNegativeKeywordState.description: The current state of the negative keyword.

SBNegativeTargetId.description: The identifier of a negative target.

campaignId.description: The identifier of an existing campaign. The newly created target is associated to this campaign

themeId.description: The identifier of the theme target.

ThemeType.description:
The theme target type.
- KEYWORDS_RELATED_TO_YOUR_BRAND - keywords related to brands.
- KEYWORDS_RELATED_TO_YOUR_LANDING_PAGES - keywords related to your landing pages.
- Note: Additional theme types may be added in the future.

UploadLocation.description: The url to upload the media. The url expires in 15 minutes. The upload location only supports `PUT` HTTP Method to upload the media content.

oauth2AuthorizationCode.description: Login with Amazon. For more information see [Login with Amazon authorization code grant](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/login-with-amazon/authorization-code-grant.html).

scopes.cpc_advertising:campaign_management: Modify your advertising campaigns and access performance data

get.description: Gets an array of Brand data objects for the Brand associated with the profile ID passed in the header. For more information about Brands, see [Brand Services](https://brandservices.amazon.com/).

parameters.description: The returned array is filtered to include only brands with brand type set to one of the values in the specified comma-delimited list. Returns all brands if not specified.
parameters.name: brandTypeFilter

brandEntityId.description: The Brand entity identifier available exclusively for seller advertisers.

put.description: The API should be called once the media is uploaded to the location provided by the /media/upload API endpoint. The API creates a Media resource for the uploaded media.

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

version.description: The version id of the uploaded media. The upload location retrieved from /media/upload API supports versioning and returns version id in the upload response through `x-amz-version-id` header.

put.summary: The API is used to notify that the upload is completed.

get.description:
API to poll for media status.
In order to attach media to campaign, media should be in either `PendingDeepValidation` or `Available` status.

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

parameters.description: Media Identifier
parameters.name: mediaId

originalMediaUrl.description: This is a signed URL which returns the original media in .mp4 file extension. The URL is only active for 7 days and requires to be regenerated if the video is not downloaded within 7 days. If you try to upload the downloaded video using the Asset Library API and get an error, then please retry upload after changing the file extension to .mov.

publishedMediaUrl.description: The preview URL of the media. It is only available when status is `Available`.

items.description: Additional status metadata. It is only available when status is `Failed` and `statusMetadata` provides additional detail on why media status is `Failed`. `statusMetadata` is comprised of code and message.

get.summary: API to poll for media status

get.description: Note that for sellers, the addresss must be a Store page. Vendors may also specify a custom landing page address.

parameters.description: For sellers, the address of a Store page. Vendors may also specify the address of a custom landing page. For more information, see the [Stores section](https://advertising.amazon.com/help#GPRM3ZHEXEY5RBFZ) of the Amazon Ads support center.
parameters.name: pageUrl

asinList.description: An array of ASINs. Note that this field is present only if there were no errors during the request. If there were errors, the `code` field is the enumerated error, and the `details` field contains a human-readable description of the error.

code.description:
The enumerated response code.
| Code | Description |
|------|--------|
|SUCCESS| The request was successful. The `asinList` field includes all available ASINs.|
|INVALID_ARGUMENT| The request was not successful because the address was not for a valid landing page.|
|BAD_GATEWAY| The request failed because the landing page at the specified address did not have any ASINs.|

details.description: A human-readable description of the `code` field.

get.summary: Gets ASIN information for a specified address.

post.description:
A rule enables an automatic budget increase for a specified date range or for a special event. The response also includes a suggested budget increase for each special event.

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["advertiser_campaign_edit","advertiser_campaign_view"]

429.description: Too Many Requests. Request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something went wrong on the server.

post.summary: Gets a list of special events with suggested date range and suggested budget increase for a campaign specified by identifier.

get.description: **Note**: Keywords associated with BrandVideo ad groups are only available in v3.2 version.

parameters.description: Sets a zero-based offset into the requested set of keywords. Use in conjunction with the `count` parameter to control pagination of the returned array.
parameters.name: startIndex

parameters.description: Sets the number of keywords in the returned array. Use in conjunction with the `startIndex` parameter to control pagination. For example, to return the first ten keywords set `startIndex=0` and `count=10`. To return the next ten keywords, set `startIndex=10` and `count=10`, and so on.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: The returned array is filtered to include only keywords with `matchType` set to one of the values in the specified comma-delimited list.
parameters.name: matchTypeFilter

parameters.description: The returned array includes only keywords with the specified text.
parameters.name: keywordText

parameters.description: The returned array is filtered to include only keywords with 'state' set to one of the values in the specified comma-delimited list.
parameters.name: stateFilter

parameters.description: The returned array includes only keywords associated with campaigns matching those specified by identifier in the comma-delimited string.
parameters.name: campaignIdFilter

parameters.description: The returned array includes only keywords associated with ad groups matching those specified by identifier in the comma-delimited string.
parameters.name: adGroupIdFilter

parameters.description: The returned array includes only keywords with identifiers matching those specified in the comma-delimited string.
parameters.name: keywordIdFilter

parameters.description: Filter by the type of creative the campaign is associated with. To get keywords associated with non-video campaigns specify 'productCollection'. To get keywords associated with video campaigns, this must be set to 'video'. Returns all keywords if not specified.
parameters.name: creativeType

parameters.description: The returned array includes only keywords with locale matching those specified string.
parameters.name: locale

get.summary: Gets an array of keywords, filtered by optional criteria.

post.description:
Note that `state` can't be set at keyword creation.
Note that keywords can be created on campaigns where serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected`, or `ended`.
Note that this operation supports a maximum list size of 100 keywords.

adGroupId.description: The identifier of an existing ad group to which the keyword is associated.

bid.description: The bid associated with the keyword. Note that this value must be less than the budget associated with the Advertiser account. For more information, see [Keyword bid constraints by marketplace](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/reference/concepts/limits#bid-constraints-by-marketplace).

campaignId.description: The identifier of an existing campaign to which the keyword is associated.

keywordText.description: The keyword text. The maximum number of words for this string is 10.

nativeLanguageKeyword.description: The unlocalized keyword text in the preferred locale of the advertiser.

nativeLanguageLocale.description: The locale preference of the advertiser. For example, if the advertiser’s preferred language is Simplified Chinese, set the locale to `zh_CN`. Supported locales include: Simplified Chinese (locale: zh_CN) for US, UK and CA. English (locale: en_GB) for DE, FR, IT and ES.

requestBody.description:
An array of keywords.
Note the bid is only mutable when the keyword's corresponding campaign does not have any enabled optimization rule.

207.description: Multi-status. Note that the order of the returned array matches the order of the array passed in the request.

put.description: Updates one or more targeting clauses. Operation supports a maximum list size of 100 keywords. <bold>Note</bold> that negative keywords can be updated on campaigns where campaign's serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected`, or `ended`.

adGroupId.description: The identifier of an existing ad group to which the keyword is associated.

bid.description: The bid associated with the keyword. Note that this value must be less than the budget associated with the Advertiser account.

campaignId.description: The identifier of an existing campaign to which the keyword is associated.

requestBody.description:
An array of keywords.
Note the bid is only mutable when the keyword's corresponding campaign does not have any enabled optimization rule.

207.description: Multi-status. Note that the order of the returned array matches the order of the array passed in the request.

delete.description: This operation is equivalent to an update operation that sets the status field to 'archived'. Note that setting the status field to 'archived' is permanent and can't be undone. See [Developer Notes](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/v2/guides/developer_notes) for more information.

404.description: Bad request. Keyword identifier not found.

delete.summary: Archives a keyword specified by identifier.

parameters.description: The identifier of an existing keyword.
parameters.name: keywordId

parameters.description: The returned array includes only keywords associated with locale matching those specified by identifier.
parameters.name: locale

404.description: Bad request. Keyword identifier not found.

get.summary: Gets a keyword specified by identifier.

get.description: Note that this resource is only available for campaigns in the US marketplace.

parameters.description: The campaign identifier.
parameters.name: campaignId

campaignId.description: The campaign identifier.

etaForModeration.description: Expected date and time by which moderation will be complete. Note that this field is present in the response only when `moderationStatus` is set to `IN_PROGRESS`.

moderationStatus.description:
The moderation status of the campaign.
|Status|Description|
|------|-----------|
|APPROVED|Moderation for the campaign is complete.|
|IN_PROGRESS|Moderation for the campaign is in progress. The expected date and time for completion are specfied in the `etaForModeration` field.|
|REJECTED|The campaign has failed moderation. Specific information about the content that violated policy is available in `policyViolations`.|

policyViolations.description: A list of policy violations for a campaign that has failed moderation. Note that this field is present in the response only when `moderationStatus` is set to `REJECTED`.

policyDescription.description: A human-readable description of the policy.

policyLinkUrl.description: Address of the policy documentation. Follow the link to learn more about the specified policy.

violatingAsinContents.description: Information about the specific ASIN in the campaign that violates the specified policy.

asin.description: The ASIN that violates the specified policy.

moderatedComponent.description: The ad component that includes the ASIN that violates the specified policy.

violatingImageContents.description: Information about the specific image that violates the specified policy.

height.description: The height of the content that violates the specified policy within the image.

topLeftX.description: The top left X-coordinate of the content that violates the specfied policy within the image.

topLeftY.description: The top left Y-coordinate of the content that violates the specfied policy within the image.

width.description: The width of the content that violates the specified policy within the image.

moderatedComponent.description: The ad component that includes the image that violates the specified policy.

reviewedImageUrl.description: Address of the image reviewed during moderation.

violatingTextContents.description: Information about the specific text that violates the specified policy in the campaign.

moderatedComponent.description: The ad component that includes the text that violates the specified policy.

reviewedText.description: The specific text reviewed during moderation.

violatingText.description: The specific text determined to violate the specified policy in `reviewedText`.

end.description: Zero-based index into the text in `reviewedText` where the text specified in `violatingText` ends.

start.description: Zero-based index into the text in `reviewedText` where the text specified in `violatingText` starts.

get.summary: Gets the moderation result for a campaign specified by identifier.

get.summary: Gets a negative keyword specified by identifier.

requestBody.description:
A list of negative targeting clauses for creation.
Note that negative targeting clauses can be created on campaigns where serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected`, or `ended`.
Note that this operation supports a maximum list size of 100 negative targets.

200.description: A list of success and error results for targeting clauses submitted for creation.

post.summary: Create one or more negative targets.

requestBody.description:
A list of negative targets with updated values.
Note that negative targeting clauses can be created on campaigns where serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected`, or `ended`.
Note that this operation supports a maximum list size of 100 negative targets.

updateTargetErrorResults.description: Lists errors that occured during negative target update. Note that errors are correlated to negative target update requests by the `negativeTargetRequestIndex` field. This field corresponds to the order of the negative target in the request. For example, if `negativeTargetRequestIndex` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third negative target object in the request.

updateTargetSuccessResults.description: Lists the successfully updated negative targets. Note that negative targets in the response are correlated to negative targets in the request using the `targetRequestIndex` field. For example, if `targetRequestIndex` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third negative target object in the request.

200.description: A list of success and error results for negative targets submitted for update.

put.summary: Updates one or more negative targets.

post.description: **Note**: Negative targets associated with BrandVideo ad groups are only available in v3.2 version.

filters.description: Restricts results to negative targets with the specified filters.  Filters are inclusive. Filters are joined using 'and' logic. Specify one each type of filter. Specifying multiples of the same type of filter results in an error.

filterType.description: Set `filterType` to `CREATIVE_TYPE` to filter by creative type. If no filter is specified, all negative targets will be returned.
Set `filterType` to `TARGETING_STATE` to filter by negative target state.

values.description: A list of negative target states.

filterType.description: Set `filterType` to `CAMPAIGN_ID` to filter by campaign identifiers.
Set `filterType` to `AD_GROUP_ID` to filter by ad group identifier.

values.description: A list of ad group identifiers.

post.summary: Gets a list of product negative targets associated with the client identifier passed in the authorization header, filtered by specified criteria.

delete.summary: Archives a negative target specified by identifier. Note that archiving is permanent, and once a negative target has been archived it can't be made active again.

parameters.description: The identifier of an existing negative target.
parameters.name: negativeTargetId

get.summary: Gets a negative target specified by identifier.

post.description: Get a list of bid recommendation objects for a specified list of keywords or products.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign for which bid recommendations are created.

costType.description:
Optional. Support `CPC` (cost per click) and `VCPM` (cost per thousand viewable impressions).
| costType | goal | Expected result |
|----------|------|-----------------|
| Empty | Empty | Recommendati...

keywords.description: Sum of the sizes of (targets + keywords + themeTypes) arrays should be <= 100

targets.description: Sum of the sizes of (targets + keywords + themeTypes) arrays should be <= 100

themeTypes.description: Sum of the sizes of (targets + keywords + themeTypes) arrays should be <= 100

requestBody.description: A list of keywords or targeting expressions for which to generate bid recommendations. Note that if a value is specified for the `campaignId` field, the past performance data for the campaign may be use to create bid recommendations.

keywordsBidsRecommendationErrorResults.description: Lists errors that occurred during creation of keyword bid recommendations.

keywordsBidsRecommendationSuccessResults.description: Lists the bid recommendations for the keywords specified in the request.

recommendationId.description: The identifier of the keyword bid recommendation.

targetsBidsRecommendationErrorResults.description: Lists errors that occurred during creation of target bid recommendations.

targetsBidsRecommendationSuccessResults.description: Lists the bid recommendations for the keywords or targets specified in the request.

recommendationId.description: The identifier of the target bid recommendation.

themesRecommendationErrorResults.description: Lists errors that occurred during creation of theme targets bid recommendations.

themesRecommendationSuccessResults.description: Lists the theme targets recommendations for the theme targets specified in the request.

recommendationId.description: The identifier of the target bid recommendation.

post.description:
Gets an array of keyword recommendation objects for a set of ASINs included either on a landing page or a Stores page. Vendors may also specify a custom landing page.

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["advertiser_campaign_edit","advertiser_campaign_view"]

requestBody.description:
**Must contain exactly only one of** 

 1.) An array of ASINs for which keyword recommendations are generated. 

 2.) The URL of a Stores page.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Request was rate-limited. Retry later

500.description: Internal Server SB Keyword Recommendations Error - Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an SB Keyword Recommendations Error if unresolved.

post.description: The Brand suggestions are based on a list of either category identifiers or keywords passed in the request. It is not valid to specify both category identifiers and keywords in the request.

categoryId.description: The category identifier for which to get recommendations.

keyword.description: The keyword for which to get recommendations.

post.summary: Gets a list of brand suggestions.

post.description: Recommendations are based on the ASINs that are passed in the request.

parameters.description: Return the categories in the specified locale.
parameters.name: locale

supplySource.description: (As of 05/28/2024, `STREAMING_VIDEO` is deprecated). The supply source of the campaign. Use `AMAZON` for placements on Amazon website. Use `STREAMING_VIDEO` for off-site video placements such as IMDb TV. Default value is `AMAZON`.

200.description: A list of category targeting recommendations.

post.summary: Gets a list of recommended categories for targeting.

post.description: Recommendations are based on the ASINs that are passed in the request.

filters.description: Restricts recommendations to the criteria specified in the filters.

200.description: A list of product targeting recommendations.

post.summary: Gets a list of recommended products for targeting.

requestBody.description:
A list of targeting clauses for creation.
Note that targets can be created on campaigns where serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected`, or `ended`.

200.description: A list of success and error results for targeting clauses submitted for creation.

requestBody.description:
A list of targets with updated values.
Note that targets can be updated on campaigns where serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected`, or `ended`.

updateTargetErrorResults.description: Lists errors that occured during target update. Note that errors are correlated to target update requests by the `targetRequestIndex` field. This field corresponds to the order of the target in the request. For example, if `targetRequestIndex` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third target object in the request array.

updateTargetSuccessResults.description: Lists the successfully updated targets. Note that targets in the response are correlated to targets in the request using the `targetRequestIndex` field. For example, if `targetRequestIndex` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third target object in the request.

200.description: A list of success and error results for targets submitted for update.

post.description:
Gets a list of product targets associated with the client identifier passed in the authorization header, filtered by specified criteria.

**Note**: Product targets associated with BrandVideo ad groups are only available in v3.2 version.

filters.description: Restricts results to targets with the specified filters.  Filters are inclusive. Filters are joined using 'and' logic. Specify one type of each filter. Specifying multiples of the same type of filter results in an error.

filterType.description: Set `filterType` to `CREATIVE_TYPE` to filter by creative type. If no filter is specified, all targets will be returned.
Set `filterType` to `TARGETING_STATE` to filter by target state.
Set `filterType` to `CAMPAIGN_ID` to filter by campaign identifiers.
Set `filterType` to `AD_GROUP_ID` to filter by ad group identifier.

values.description: A list of ad group identifiers.

adGroupId.description: The identifier of the ad group to which the target is associated.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign to which the target is associated.

adGroupId.description: The identifier of the ad group to which the target is associated.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the campaign to which the target is associated.

delete.description: The identifier of an existing target.
delete.summary: Archives a target specified by identifier. Note that archiving is permanent, and once a target has been archived it can't be made active again.

parameters.description: The identifier of an existing target.
parameters.name: targetId

get.summary: Gets a target specified by identifier.

post.description: Note that this endpoint does not support for **Author profiles**.

requestBody.description:
A list of theme targets for creation.
Note that theme targets can be created on multi-adGroups campaigns and where campaign serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected`, or `...

200.description: A list of success and error results for theme targets submitted for creation.

post.summary: Create one or more theme targets.

put.description: Note that this endpoint does not support for **Author profiles**.

requestBody.description:
A list of theme targets with updated values.
Note that theme targets can be updated on multi-adGroups campaigns and where campaign serving status is not one of `archived`, `terminated`, `rejected...

error.description: Lists errors that occurred during theme target update. Note that errors are correlated to theme target update requests by the `index` field. This field corresponds to the order of the theme target in the request. For example, if `index` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third theme target object in the request array.

success.description: Lists the successfully updated theme targets. Note that theme targets in the response are correlated to theme targets in the request using the `index` field. For example, if `index` is set to `2`, the values correlate to the third theme target object in the request.

200.description: A list of success and error results for theme targets submitted for update.

put.summary: Updates one or more theme targets.

post.description: Note that this endpoint does not support for **Author profiles**. Gets a list of theme targets associated with the client identifier passed in the authorization header, filtered by specified criteria.

adGroupIdFilter.description: A list of ad group identifiers.

stateFilter.description: A list of theme target states.

themeIdFilter.description: A list of theme targets identifiers.

themeTypeFilter.description: A list of theme target type.

get.description: For sellers or vendors, gets an array of assets associated with the specified brand entity identifier. Vendors are not required to specify a brand entity identifier, and in this case all assets associated with the vendor are returned.

parameters.description: For sellers, this field is required. It is the Brand entity identifier of the Brand for which assets are returned. This identifier is retrieved using the [getBrands operation](https://advertising.
parameters.name: brandEntityId

parameters.description: Specifies the media types used to filter the returned array. Currently, only the `brandLogo` type is supported. If not specified, all media types are returned.
parameters.name: mediaType

assetID.description: The identifier of an asset associated with a store.

url.description: The address where the asset is stored.

get.summary: Gets a list of assets associated with a specified brand entity identifier.

post.description: Image assets are stored in the Store Assets Library. Note that there may be a delay before the image is displayed in the console.

parameters.description: The name of the image file.
parameters.name: Content-Disposition

parameters.description:
The image format type. The following table lists the valid image types:
|Image Type|Description|
|----------|-----------|
|PNG|[Portable network graphics](https://en.wikipedia.
parameters.name: Content-Type

asset.description: The binary data for the image. For more information,  File size must be smaller than 1MB, and the resolution must be a minimum of 400 pixels by 400 pixels.

assetInfo.description: A JSON object specifying the Brand entity identifier an media type. The Brand entity identifier is optional, but media type is not.

post.description: Use this interface to request and retrieve performance reports. **To understand the call flow for asynchronous reports, see [Getting started with sponsored ads reports](/API/docs/en-us/guides/reportin...

parameters.description: The type of report. Valid types are `campaigns`, `adGroups`, `ads`, `targets`, and `keywords`.
parameters.name: recordType

creativeType.description: Optional. Supported values are `video` (for video campaigns) and `all` (for both non-video and video campaigns). If not specified, the report will contain data for non-video campaigns.

metrics.description: Each report type supports different metrics. **To understand supported metrics for each report type, see [Report types](/API/docs/en-us/guides/reporting/v2/report-types).**

reportDate.description: Date in YYYYMMDD format. The report only contains performance data for the specified date. The time zone is specified by the profile used to request the report.

segment.description: Optional. Allows you to run a report based on secondary dimensions. Use `placement` to segment a `campaigns` report by the location on a page where your ad appears. Use `query` to segment a `keywords` report and create a search terms report.

recordType.description: The record type of the report. It can be `campaign`, `adGroup`, `keyword`, or `targets`.

reportId.description: The unique ID for your requested report.

status.description: The status of the report. Status is one of `IN_PROGRESS`, `SUCCESS`, or `FAILURE`.

406.description: Failed due to report date being too far in the past. Reports are not available for data older than 60 days.

422.description: Report formed incorrectly. Report requests return a 422 status code if the parameters specified are unrecognized or if the combination of parameters is not supported.

post.summary: Requests the creation of a report containing performance data related to Sponsored Brands campaigns.

get.description: To understand the call flow for asynchronous reports, see [Getting started with sponsored ads reports](/API/docs/en-us/guides/reporting/v2/sponsored-ads-reports).

parameters.description: Report ID returned by POST report method.
parameters.name: reportId

reportId.description: The unique ID for your requested report.

status.description: The status of the report. Status is one of `IN_PROGRESS`, `SUCCESS`, or `FAILURE`.

get.summary: Returns the status of a previously requested report.

get.description: Gets a `307 Temporary Redirect` response that includes a `location` header with the value set to an AWS S3 path where the report is located. The path expires after 30 seconds.

parameters.description: The identifier of the requested report.
parameters.name: reportId

404.description: Not found - requested resource does not exist or is not visible for the authenticated user.

429.description: Too many requests - request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal server error - something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved.

get.summary: Downloads a previously requested report identified by `reportId`.
